page.title: 17Children
page.content: Children who live in the country usually go to the village school, but before they are old enough to go to school they go to a play group in the Village Hall. Here the mothers and helpers organise activities for the children. This is especially important for children who live in isolated places as they are able to meet friends and learn to share. Although there are lots of fields and open spaces there is no special place for children to play. Most of them have gardens at home but as they get older they would like to have a place where they could play football or other games. There are no organised groups like Cub Scouts or Brownies in the village.The children who want to join these organisations have to be taken to another village by their parents.
